column5: So yesterday lazlo was the first to show up at my house and seconds later CCMT and Fishnsled were there too.  So we all packed into fishnsleds truck and head to Scugog.  Did a quick stop for some minnows and off we go to Goreskis and to meet up with JohnnyD.  Let me tell you, that was one hard walk in that much snow dragging a clam 2000 with a full load of gear.  What should take 10 min turned into almost 30 min     We got a close to the spot as we could but someone moved a perm. hut right on top of where I wanted to get set up.  So we punched a bunch of holes, put the fishtv down to see what I could see and then started fishing. After I got the hut set up for use when it got real cold and decided to go over to Laker272s hut and say hi and see how they were doing. Got back to the guys and JohnnyD used his flasher to tease up the perch that was pestering him down below.  A few min later, a decent boarder line keeper crappie.  We kept it cause I have never tried to eat them and if we got enough then woo hoo. Fishnsled and CCMT were close enough that we could hear them and not sure how many they got in that hut but none were kept. I decided now that the sun was down to switch up to a bigger bait and try for an eye.  Lazlo and I tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and tried and came up empty…  just short strikes on the tail of the bait. At 7:15/7:20 we decided to pack it in and head home.  I think it was either -24 or -25 when we got in the truck to head home. At the end of it, I dont care that I didnt land any of the short hits I kept getting.  I was out and having a good time with some fishing buddies, cheers. Geoff
sounded like a lot of fun!  I was trying to weasel out but failed with the wife...  Is the bite any good after 8:00pm?  I may be able to sneak out on Saturday night after the kids are asleep.   Nick
And not a mention of ANY fish coming out of CCMT and FnS's hut!!! I'm surprised!!LOL... NOT! HH
That is indeed all that matters at the end of the day Geoff.  Brrrrrr, you warmed up yet.
At least the fish were safe
Having fun is what it is all about Geoff.  Good that you guys had a good time in cold conditions.
you caught one more than I did Geoff!    Even Averie caught some gobies!  Cheers, Ryan

1 crappie iced and back down the hole. Couple of hits and one fish lost for myself. As for Cliff.........I'll let him answer.  A great evening on the ice none the less. Thanks for doing up the report Geoff.
At least you got out and had another opportunity for some stimulating conversation... Bah Hah! HH
Yup, getting out with buddies to fish is what matters.  Sounds like a good time, and a good workout  Joey
yup if you get fish it's a bonus just getting out doing something and some friends near by is what it is all about
The bog is hurtin this year......and last!!!  S.
I was out today on the bog with DMASSE as well.  Tons of tiny perch, a few jumbos, but no crappie.  Great day none the less!

Out with buddies on the ice...hmmmmm....does it get any better?  Sounds freekin cold Geoff, the walleye dont bite at nite on most of the lakes i fish, but sometimes i almost stay till 8pm anyway...cuz packing up means turning the heater off and going outside...lol.  Keep up the good workkk.

Good report even if you didnt get any keepers. it was -28 all night on simcoe last night but i didnt mind. i know what you mean about the snow too, simcoe got wacked with it too. and my sleigh had lots of gear in it but i didnt find it hard going.  As long as you guys had fun thats all that matters!!!!

Who asked you Joe??? LOL.   Yep...no fish were harmed in the making of this report!   After lugging the sled out there, I was much too tired to fish...that's my excuse and I'm sticking to it.   Yep...we talked about you mostly.
I did say that it was stimulating!!!! LOL HH
